org.atteo.moonshine.websocket.jsonmessages

Interface JsonMessages.Factory

  • Enclosing class:
    JsonMessages

    public static interface JsonMessages.Factory

    • Method Summary

      <T> JsonMessages.Factory addHandler(T handler)

    • Method Detail

      • addHandler

        <T> JsonMessages.Factory addHandler(T handler)
        Adds handler.

        Handler is an object with methods annotated with OnMessage annotation. Each such method must take exactly one argument whose type should implement JsonMessage interface and be annotated with JsonTypeName. Such method will be called when message of matching type will be received. Optionally handler method can return JsonMessage object which will be then sent back to the message sender.

      • addSender

        <T> SenderProvider<T> addSender(Class<T> senderClass)
        Adds message sender.

        Message sender allows you to send messages through WebSocket. The approach here is similiar to that of Spring Data. You provide an interface with sender methods. Each such method should take exactly one argument whose type should implement JsonMessage interface and be annotated with JsonTypeName. The returned object SenderProvider allows you to retrieve implementation of the interface for given Session. You can then call sender methods to send given message.

      • connect

        javax.websocket.Session connect(URI uri)
        Connect to the specified uri.

        After the connection is established any registered handlers can be called when matching message will be received through this Web Socket.

      • connect

        javax.websocket.Session connect(WebServerAddress webServerAddress)
                                throws URISyntaxException
        Connect to the specified web server.

        This is helper method mainly for use in tests which calls connect(URI) with the address derived from given web server address.

        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
